abstract: What was supposed to be a shortcut for Facebook users to log into their pages ended up exposing their e-mail addresses, potentially allowing access to their accounts as well.
snippet: What was supposed to be a shortcut for Facebook users to log into their pages ended up exposing their e-mail addresses, potentially allowing access to their accounts as well.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — What was supposed to be a shortcut for Facebook users to log into their pages ended up exposing their e-mail addresses — and, in some cases, potentially allowing access to their accounts as well.

headline.main: Facebook Cancels Shortcut Over Concern for Security
headline.print_headline: Facebook Cancels Shortcut Over Concern for Security
